page.title: 15CHURCHES,LICKEY/CATSHILL
page.content: There were eight churches in this area until the small Methodist chapel at Lickey End was demolished to make way for the new M42. Two of the churches are {Anglican. Holy Trinity, Lickey, was built in 1856 and now has about 100 members. It runs a weekly club for children called 'Trinians'. St Luke's Church Centre is part of the Catshill parish. Two are {Methodist}. Catshill has 150 members and Wildmoor, built in 1893, has about 50. Catshill{Baptist}has about 150 members. Rednal Gospel Mission, associated with the {Elim Pentecostal}movement, has about 50 members. Welcome Hall {Evangelical}Church in Catshill is a modern meeting hall. Every church has a morning and evening service with a children's service and a variety of weekday activities.
